description: A small desert village in the Alabasta Kingdom surrounded by sand but featuring vibrant vegetation including grass, trees, and bushes. The buildings are constructed from adobe-like material. Despite the ongoing civil conflict in Alabasta, Ido remains peaceful under the protection of what the villagers believe are Rebel Army soldiers.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Ido
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, accompanied by Vivi and Ace, arrive at the peaceful desert village of Ido.
keyEvents.significance: Sets the stage for the episode's story about fake heroes and true courage.

keyEvents.title: Fake Rebels Protecting Ido
keyEvents.description: The village is revealed to be under the protection of Camus and his gang, who are posing as Rebel Army soldiers.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the central conflict of the episode.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Tests Camus
keyEvents.description: Luffy confronts Camus in the village to test whether he has the courage to truly protect Ido.
keyEvents.significance: The test that determines whether Camus earns the right to stay as the village's protector.

keyEvents.title: Village Celebrates Their Heroes
keyEvents.description: The villagers celebrate Camus and his companions as heroes after they appear to drive away the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyEvents.significance: Completes the transformation of fake rebels into genuine protectors.

statusHistory.reason: Village remains peaceful under Camus's protection

culturalSignificance: A village where children dream of becoming heroes like the legendary guardians Chaka and Pell
notes: Ido is an anime-only location that appears exclusively in this filler episode. The village represents themes of heroism and living up to expectations.
